{{{
<h3>WEAPONS</h3>
<p>The weapon types structure is from game.h</p>
<p><font face="Courier New" size="2">struct weaptypes<br>
{<br>
int info, anim, colour, sound, esound, fsound, rsound,<br>
add, max, sub[2], adelay[2], rdelay, damage[2], speed[2], power, time[2],<br>
delay, explode[2], rays[2], spread[2], zdiv[2],<br>
collide[2], radial[2];<br>
bool taper[2], extinguish[2], burns[2], follows[2], reloads, zooms, fullauto[2], 
thrown[2];<br>
float elasticity[2], reflectivity[2], relativity[2], waterfric[2], weight[2], 
partsize[2], partlen[2],<br>
kickpush[2], hitpush[2], maxdist[2], halo;<br>
const char *name, *text, *item, *vwep, *proj;<br>
}</font></p>
<p>Thus the weapons consists of&nbsp; the same bunch of data and a model. The 
model may not contribute to the projectile/fx, which makes it easier with Mechs.&nbsp; 
I have tabulated it below, hopefullu ,aking it a bit 
more explicable below:<br>
